# locationNumber

**Instance Property**

A specific GPU position based on its general location.

## Declaration

```swift
var locationNumber: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

The meaning of the location number depends on a device’s [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/location] property:

- For [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDeviceLocation/builtIn], the location number is `0` for low-power GPUs (see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/isLowPower]) and `1` for other GPUs.
- For [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDeviceLocation/slot], the location number represents the slot.
- For [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDeviceLocation/external], the location number represents the Thunderbolt port.



## Identifying a GPU device

- **name**: The full name of the GPU device.
- **architecture**: The architectural details of the GPU device.
- **MTLArchitecture**: A class that contains the architectural details of a GPU device.
- **registryID**: The GPU device’s registry identifier.
- **location**: The physical location of the GPU relative to the system.
- **MTLDeviceLocation**: Indicates the location of the GPU relative to the system it’s connect to.
- **isLowPower**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the GPU lowers its performance to conserve energy.
- **isRemovable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the GPU is removable.
- **isHeadless**: A Boolean value that indicates whether a GPU device doesn’t have a connection to a display.
- **peerGroupID**: The peer group ID the GPU belongs to, if applicable.
- **peerCount**: The total number of GPUs in the peer group, if applicable.
- **peerIndex**: The unique identifier for a GPU in a peer group.
